instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> one more serial problem?
threads.message:
i have 2 devices with the same problem. had one last month, customer needed to backup his data - so he took the device as soon as he saw apple logo (in urgent cases i allow customer to see the process)
power button does not work, kind of shorted but not. call me dumb, i do not get it.
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> high on board with trackpad+keyboard attached, no reaction on the power button, ALT+CTRL+SHIFT resets SMC as if the power button was pressed.
ejected power button, 0.3v on pads, resistance 500kohm connected/unconnected.
traced <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> to the trackpad has no direct trace to a keyboard button.
works perfectly fine with <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> pads - turns screen on and off, shuts down the device after 8 seconds, works fine with and without keyboard attached.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> one more serial problem?
threads.message:
Do you mean it always works using <RESISTOR>R5225</RESISTOR>/56 pads, but never responds to power button?

"ejected power button, 0.3v on pads"
One pad should beep with ground.
Maybe trace for other pad is broken, or bad connection to MLB.
Start checking J4801.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> one more serial problem?
threads.message: yup, i mean <RESISTOR>R5226</RESISTOR>. Trace is perfectly fine as well as cable/jack. I guess i need to order the whole topcase to localize this issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> one more serial problem?
threads.message:
OK, solved. that was a keyboard damage and since i happend with two devices i decided to repair it instead of replacing the keyboard. 
on keyborard jack , pin 8 from left, jumper to the testpad 2cm higher(just near the partnummer stuff), first row 3 from right is a SMC OnOff. 
quick diagnose - carefully remove Power button and check if 3.3 v is present or shorted to ground. in my case one had a short to ground, second was broken.
